verses.text: Behold, the day of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* cometh , and thy spoil shall be divided in the midst of thee.

For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle ; and the city shall be taken , and the houses rifled , and the women ravished ; and half of the city shall go forth into captivity , and the residue of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
Then shall the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* go forth , and fight against those nations , as when he fought in the day of battle. \p

¶ And his feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of Olives , which \add is\add* before Jerusalem on the east , and the mount of Olives shall cleave in the midst thereof toward the east and toward the west , \add and there shall be\add* a very great valley ; and half of the mountain shall remove toward the north , and half of it toward the south.

And ye shall flee \add to\add* the valley of the mountains ; for the valley of the mountains shall reach unto Azal : yea, ye shall flee , like as ye fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah : and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* my God shall come , \add and\add* all the saints with thee.\f + \fr 14.5 \ft the mountains: or, my mountains\f*\f + \fr 14.5 \ft for the…: or, when he shall touch the valley of the mountains to the place he separated\f*

And it shall come to pass in that day , \add that\add* the light shall not be clear , \add nor\add* dark :\f + \fr 14.6 \ft that the…: that is, it shall not be clear in some places, and dark in other places of the world\f*\f + \fr 14.6 \ft clear: Heb. precious\f*\f + \fr 14.6 \ft dark: Heb. thickness\f*

But it shall be one day which shall be known to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, not day , nor night : but it shall come to pass, \add that\add* at evening time it shall be light.\f + \fr 14.7 \ft it shall be…: or, the day shall be one\f* \p

And it shall be in that day , \add that\add* living waters shall go out from Jerusalem ; half of them toward the former sea , and half of them toward the hinder sea : in summer and in winter shall it be.\f + \fr 14.8 \ft former: or, eastern\f*

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall be king over all the earth : in that day shall there be one 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and his name one.

All the land shall be turned as a plain from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem : and it shall be lifted up , and inhabited in her place, from Benjamin’s gate unto the place of the first gate , unto the corner gate , and \add from\add* the tower of Hananeel unto the king’s winepresses.\f + \fr 14.10 \ft turned: or, compassed\f*\f + \fr 14.10 \ft inhabited: or, shall abide\f*
And \add men\add* shall dwell in it, and there shall be no more utter destruction ; but Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited.\f + \fr 14.11 \ft shall be: or, shall abide\f* \p

¶ And this shall be the plague wherewith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will smite all the people that have fought against Jerusalem ; Their flesh shall consume away while they stand upon their feet , and their eyes shall consume away in their holes , and their tongue shall consume away in their mouth.

And it shall come to pass in that day , \add that\add* a great tumult from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall be among them; and they shall lay hold every one on the hand of his neighbour , and his hand shall rise up against the hand of his neighbour.

And Judah also shall fight at Jerusalem ; and the wealth of all the heathen round about shall be gathered together , gold , and silver , and apparel , in great abundance.\f + \fr 14.14 \ft Judah…: or, thou also, O Judah shalt\f*\f + \fr 14.14 \ft at: or, against\f*
And so shall be the plague of the horse , of the mule , of the camel , and of the ass , and of all the beasts that shall be in these tents , as this plague. \p

¶ And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* every one that is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem shall even go up from year to year to worship the King , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , and to keep the feast of tabernacles.

And it shall be, \add that\add* whoso will not come up of \add all\add* the families of the earth unto Jerusalem to worship the King , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , even upon them shall be no rain.

And if the family of Egypt go not up , and come not, that \add have\add* no \add rain;\add* there shall be the plague , wherewith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will smite the heathen that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.\f + \fr 14.18 \ft that have no: Heb. upon whom there is not\f*
This shall be the punishment of Egypt , and the punishment of all nations that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.\f + \fr 14.19 \ft punishment: or, sin\f* \p

¶ In that day shall there be upon the bells of the horses , HOLINESS UNTO THE 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; and the pots in the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* house shall be like the bowls before the altar.  +  r 14.20  t bells: or, bridles *

Yea, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah shall be holiness unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts : and all they that sacrifice shall come and take of them, and seethe therein: and in that day there shall be no more the Canaanite in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts.
